title: Greek Mythology Figures Quiz
description: How well do you remember the gods, heroes, and legends of ancient Greece?

questions.question: Who was the king of the Greek gods and ruler of Mount Olympus?
questions.explanation: Zeus was the king of the Olympian gods, god of the sky, lightning, and thunder, and ruler of Mount Olympus.

questions.question: Which hero slew the Minotaur in the Labyrinth of Crete?
questions.explanation: Theseus entered the Labyrinth and slew the Minotaur, using a thread given by Ariadne to find his way back out.

questions.question: Who was the Greek goddess of wisdom and warfare?
questions.explanation: Athena was the goddess of wisdom, warfare, and crafts. She was born fully armored from the head of Zeus.

questions.question: Which Greek hero had to complete twelve labors as penance?
questions.explanation: Heracles (Hercules in Roman mythology) was tasked with twelve seemingly impossible labors by King Eurystheus, including slaying the Nemean Lion and capturing Cerberus.

questions.question: Who was the Greek god of the sea?
questions.explanation: Poseidon was the god of the sea, earthquakes, and horses. He wielded a trident and was brother to Zeus and Hades.

questions.question: Which hero's only vulnerable spot was his heel?
questions.explanation: Achilles was dipped in the River Styx by his mother Thetis, making him nearly invulnerable -- except for his heel where she held him.

questions.question: Who was cursed by the gods to push a boulder up a hill for eternity?
questions.explanation: Sisyphus was condemned to roll a boulder up a hill, only to watch it roll back down, for all eternity as punishment for his deceitfulness.

questions.question: Which Titan was punished by Zeus to hold up the sky for eternity?
questions.explanation: Atlas was condemned by Zeus to hold up the celestial heavens (the sky) for eternity after the Titans lost their war against the Olympians.

questions.question: Which Greek hero took ten years to return home from the Trojan War?
questions.explanation: Odysseus (Ulysses in Roman mythology) spent ten years on his journey home to Ithaca after the Trojan War, as told in Homer's 'Odyssey.'

questions.question: Who was the Greek god of the underworld?
questions.explanation: Hades was the god of the underworld and the dead, ruling over the realm of the deceased alongside his queen Persephone.

questions.question: Which figure in Greek mythology flew too close to the sun, melting his wax wings?
questions.explanation: Icarus and his father Daedalus escaped Crete using wings made of feathers and wax. Icarus flew too close to the sun, the wax melted, and he fell into the sea.

questions.question: Which Titan stole fire from the gods and gave it to humanity?
questions.explanation: Prometheus stole fire from Mount Olympus and gave it to humanity. As punishment, Zeus had him chained to a rock where an eagle ate his liver daily.

questions.question: Who was the Greek goddess of love and beauty?
questions.explanation: Aphrodite was the goddess of love, beauty, and desire. According to one myth, she was born from the sea foam.

questions.question: Which hero slew the Gorgon Medusa, whose gaze turned people to stone?
questions.explanation: Perseus slew Medusa by using a mirrored shield to avoid her petrifying gaze and then cutting off her head with a sword given by the gods.

questions.question: Who was the messenger god with winged sandals?
questions.explanation: Hermes was the messenger of the gods, known for his winged sandals and helmet. He was also the god of commerce, thieves, and travelers.
